alert.note: Alert for Catron; Cibola; McKinley (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 10:26PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM MDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central New Mexico, including the following counties, Catron, Cibola and McKinley. * WHEN...Until 130 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1023 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms moving northward. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Tank Canyon, Agua Fria Creek, Sawyer Creek, Cebollita Creek, Pescado, Rio, San Jose, Rio, Cebolla Creek, Goat Tank Canyon, Bluewater Creek and Frenches Draw. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grants, Milan, El Morro, Pine Hill, Ramah, Bluewater Lake State Park, Bluewater Lake and San Rafael in Cibola County. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 67 and 87. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
